summary:
(RAG Format)
The patient presents with persistent emotional ambivalence regarding her sexual orientation, struggles with past relationship dynamics, and unresolved feelings of disappointment and frustration stemming from previous partners. She expresses a desire to explore her bisexual tendencies but experiences internal conflict and self-judgment, which is further compounded by lingering emotional ties to her ex-partner, Maxence. Recent relational disappointments have resurfaced past emotional wounds, leading to cyclical feelings of confusion and self-doubt.
main_issues: - Frustration and disappointment in recent relationship (Angel)
- Difficulty integrating bisexual identity with personal expectations
- Unresolved trauma linked to past abusive relationship
limiting_beliefs: - "If I explore my bisexuality, I will be judged."
- "I must choose a clear orientation to be accepted."
- "If I am not over Maxence, I can't move on."
- "I will always feel this confusion about my desires."
therapeutic_goals: - Clarify emotional needs and desires regarding sexual orientation
- Process unresolved attachment to Maxence and establish closure
- Address feelings of frustration and disappointment with Angel
- Develop strategies to navigate and embrace bisexual identity
- Implement self-soothing techniques to manage emotional flashbacks

immediate: - Grounding techniques to manage emotional flashbacks linked to past trauma
- Guided self-reflection to clarify sexual orientation and desires
- Hypnosis session recommendation: reinforcing self-acceptance and releasing self-judgment
intermediate: - Journaling to explore emotional triggers related to Maxence and Angel
- Self-compassion exercises to reduce internal criticism
- Structured dialogue to integrate bisexual identity without self-judgment
long_term: - Establish healthy relational boundaries to prevent emotional dependency
- Develop a support network to explore and express bisexual identity safely
- Hypnosis session recommendation: anchoring a sense of emotional stability and inner strength
